title: What element has 6 protons, 7 electrons, and 6 neutrons? - Quora

response.answer_text: Great question, in fact, this is a question that many may wonder. To first understand the question, we must understand that most likely, the proton and electron count is the same. Although, when it is uneven, most likely caused from a loss or gain of an electron. In this case, six protons means it is a Carbon (C) atom, in which has gained an electron. In this case, it is defined as a Carbon Ion.  If you want to know more about carbon and ions, visit these links: Protons, neutrons and electrons Basic Chemistry: Atoms and Ions carbon | Facts, Uses, & Properties

6 protons means atomic number 6. that’s carbon. the number of protons (6) plus neutrons (6) gives the mass number (12) so it would be C-12 and the fact there’s one more electron (negative) than there is protons (positive) means it would be a negative ion.
Protons number is the atomic number of an element. An element has equal no.of electrons and protons. So,it is not element but ion. Carbide ion (C-) has 6 protons,7 electrons and 6 neutrons.

If you meant what you said, then the element you’re talking about doesn’t exist, since Carbon doesn’t like to have less than 8 valence elctrons, and you can’t just take away protons without causing a nuclear explosion.
None. If you are talking about atoms, a normal atom has an equal number of protons and electrons.
This is a Carbon ion. Isotope: Carbon-12 Charge: 1-
Isotope of Carbon exists in this state
